study_parameters.description: Array of study parameter entries containing statistical and methodological details from research papers

Study Parameters ID.description: Unique ID number for each Study Parameters entry

Variant Annotation ID.description: ID number of the associated Variant Annotation. The ID number in this field will match with a 'Variant Annotation ID' in one of the three variant annotation files

Study Type.description: The type of study reported in the paper

Study Cases.description: The number of cases in the paper

Study Controls.description: The number of controls used in the association analysis in the paper

Characteristics.description: Free text entered by the curator to record details such as gender, disease, age group or other distinguishing characteristics about the group studied

Characteristics Type.description: The standardized term used to describe the 'Characteristics' field

Frequency In Cases.description: Allele frequency in the cases if clearly reported in the paper

Allele Of Frequency In Cases.description: The allele the 'Frequency in Cases' refers to

Frequency In Controls.description: Allele frequency in the controls if clearly reported in the paper

Allele Of Frequency In Controls.description: The allele the 'Frequency in Controls' refers to

P Value.description: The p-value and the operator (=, <, etc.) that is reported in the paper

Ratio Stat Type.description: The type of statistic reported in the paper: OR (odds ratio), RR (relative risk), HR (hazard ratio), or Unknown

Ratio Stat.description: The number associated with the 'Ratio Stat Type' reported in the paper

Confidence Interval Start.description: The start of the confidence interval for the 'Ratio Stat'

Confidence Interval Stop.description: The end of the confidence interval for the 'Ratio Stat'

Biogeographical Groups.description: The population groups from PMID:30506572. Options include African America/Afro-Caribbean, American, Central/South Asian, East Asian, European, Latino, Near Eastern, Oceanian, Sub-Saharan African, Unknown, Multiple Groups. The 'Multiple Groups' option indicates that the study group was comprised of people from more than one biogeographical population group

Variant Annotation ID_norm.description: Normalized version of the Variant Annotation ID
